meanings.definition: Having the aroma or flavor of thyme.
meanings.sent1: The soup had a thymy scent that reminded me of a garden.
meanings.sent2: The thymy taste of the roasted chicken made it delicious.
meanings.sent3: The thymy herbs in the salad danced on my taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The air was filled with the thymy essence of nature after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The thymy fragrance of the flowers lingered in the room.

meanings.sent1: The thymy fields stretched out as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent2: Her dress had a thymy pattern that blended well with the garden backdrop.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur looked thymy after rolling around in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The hills were thymy green, like a soft carpet under the sun.
meanings.sent5: The thymy landscape was a sight to behold on a sunny day.
